headline: DR Horton Stock Soars on Earnings. Why That’s Good News for This Home Builder ETF.
summary: D.R. Horton’s earnings—and big stock move—show there may be life in home builders yet.  Investors, investors, however, should tread carefully when comparing the two leading home-building exchange-traded funds.  The  (ITB), with $1.5 billion in assets, offers purer exposure to the sector, with nearly 50% of its weight in the top-five home builders, including D.R. Horton,  Lennar  and  Pulte  It’s a better representation of where home builders are today.

headline: Homebuilder stocks, Coca-Cola earnings, Kohl's stock skyrockets
summary: Here are some of today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in the latest Market Minute. Homebuilder stocks are rising following earnings results from DR Horton (DHI) and PulteGroup (PHM). Coca-Cola's (KO) Q2 results topped Wall Street estimates. The company announced that it will offer drinks made with cane sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup. Kohl's (KSS) shares are soaring thanks to retail traders who are hyping up the stock's performance. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: PulteGroup Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: ATLANTA, July 22, 2025--PulteGroup, Inc. (NYSE: PHM) announced today financial results for its second quarter ended June 30, 2025. For the quarter, the Company reported net income of $608 million, or $3.03 per share. Prior year reported net income of $809 million, or $3.83 per share, included a $52 million pre-tax, or $0.19 per share, insurance benefit and a $13 million, or $0.06 per share, tax benefit related to the favorable resolution of certain state tax matters, recorded in the period.

raw.headline: PulteGroup Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
raw.summary: ATLANTA, July 22, 2025--PulteGroup, Inc. (NYSE: PHM) announced today financial results for its second quarter ended June 30, 2025. For the quarter, the Company reported net income of $608 million, or $3.03 per share. Prior year reported net income of $809 million, or $3.83 per share, included a $52 million pre-tax, or $0.19 per share, insurance benefit and a $13 million, or $0.06 per share, tax benefit related to the favorable resolution of certain state tax matters, recorded in the period.
